competenciasEspecificas: 1. Understand the general meaning and specific, predictable information in short, simple texts, expressed clearly and in the standard language, using a variety of strategies and resorting, when necessary, to the use of different types of support, in order to develop the linguistic repertoire and to respond to everyday communicative needs. (CCL2, CCL3, CP1, CP2, STEM1, CD1, CPSAA5, CCEC2).

2. Produce simple texts in a comprehensible and structured way, using strategies such as planning or compensation, to express short messages related to immediate needs and to respond to everyday communicative purposes. (CCL1, CP1, CP2, STEM1, CD2, CPSAA5, CE1, CCEC4).

3. Interact with other people using everyday expressions, resorting to cooperation strategies and using analogue and digital resources, in order to respond to immediate needs of their interest in communicative exchanges respectful of the rules of courtesy. (CCL5, CP1, CP2, STEM1, CPSAA3, CC3, CE1, CE3).

4. Mediating in predictable situations, using strategies and skills to process and convey basic and simple information, in order to facilitate communication.. (CCL5, CP1, CP2, CP3, STEM1, CPSAA1, CPSAA3, CCEC1).

5. Recognise and use personal linguistic repertoires between different languages, reflecting on how they work and identifying one's own strategies and knowledge, in order to improve the response to specific communicative needs in familiar situations. (CP2, STEM1, CD2, CPSAA1, CPSAA4, CPSAA5, CE3).

6. Appreciate and respect linguistic, cultural and artistic diversity based on the foreign language, identifying and valuing the differences and similarities between languages and cultures, in order to learn to manage intercultural situations. (CCL5, CP3, CPSAA1, CPSAA3, CC2, CC3, CCEC1).
